300 is an account of the bloody Battle of Thermopylae, in antiquity, in which King Leonidas and 300 Spartans fought to the death against Xerxes and his Persian army numerous. Facing insurmountable odds, the sacrifice of these men took all of Greece to unite against their Persian enemy, drawing a milestone on the path to democracy. Inspired by the work of Frank Miller, creator of Sin City graphic novel, the film is an epic adventure that speaks of passion, courage, freedom and sacrifice embodied by the Spartan warriors who fought one of the greatest battles in history.
